content.description: Nice problem on the left side right before the traverse topout.
content.location: Start on the opening before the crack curves up and climb straight up.

content.description: ~20 move traverse with a bunch of jugs in a crack. The first few moves are the hardest and the subsequent ones are pumpy. FA footage link in the comments.
content.location: Start on a left undercling and a right sidepull. Climb left onto the jug rail and around the corner. Top out where the crack curves up.

content.description: Short problem with a low-percentage first move followed by a few somewhat strenuous moves before the top. This climb centers around the first, and hardest, move. The hold should have to be hit very precisely with the left hand for the climber to stay on. On some of the subsequent moves, I used a high flake foothold. Those moves might become slightly harder if it breaks. It's also worth noting that there is a ledge right before the top of the boulder, which makes the topout a little different than most.
content.location: Start on the arÃªte, with a downpull left crimp and a sidepull right crimp. Move left hand to an okay downpull edge and keep climbing up and to the right before topping out.

content.description: Either a one move wonder or a slopey problem, unless there's a hidden positive edge under some moss.
content.location: Start on the right part of the bar feature and either do a big move to a good sidepull or pull through some slopey edges. For this climb, go up and right. Don't use the edges to the left.

content.description: Nice vertical problem following some edges up and to the left.
content.location: Start on the left part of the bar feature and climb up and left a little bit.

content.description: Short easy problem on the backside of the boulder.
content.location: Start on the huge jug ledge and climb straight up.

content.description: Nice problem on the rounded corner.
content.location: Start with left hand in the big opening and right hand in a slot. Climb mostly straight up.
